remarks: Scott's trick collects all sets that have a certain property and are of the smallest possible rank.  This theorem shows that the resulting collection, expressed as in Equation 9.3 of [Jech] p. 72, is a set. (Contributed by NM, 13-Oct-2003.)
statement:
scottex $p |- { x e. A | A. y e. A ( rank ` x ) C_ ( rank ` y ) } e. _V $.
$d A x y $.
